Pre-Game Insights: Both teams lost their opening games in Group E and will be looking for their first win of the tournament.
Abdullah Al Hashash scored as Bahrain lost to South Korea 3-1 in their last game.
Malaysia are yet to open their account as they suffered a heavy 4-0 defeat against Jordan in their first game.
Amine Benaddi's availability for the upcoming match is uncertain.
If Safawi Rasid scores this weekend, he can climb to the seventh position in the list of all-time scorers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be played at the Jassim Bin Hamad Stadium on Saturday, with kick-off at 2.30pm GMT for fans in the UK.
The match will be shown live on TrillerTV in the UK.
Live updates can be found here on GOAL.
